Geohackweek

Workshop on geospatial data science

University of Washington eScience Institute

November 14-18, 2016

About Geohackweek

Geohackweek is a 5-day hands-on workshop in geospatial mapping , held at the University of Washington eScience Institute. Participants will learn about open source technologies used to analyze earth science data and methods for sharing their datasets in the cloud. We will provide sample datasets illustrating common data challenges in the geosciences.

Mornings will consist of interactive lectures, and afternoon sessions will involve facilitated exploration of datasets and software development.

This format is inspired by astrohackweek and neurohackweek, similar programs focused on astrophysics and neuorphysics.

Information for applicants

To best benefit from the program, participants are expected to have some experience with programming (e.g. Python or similar) and with analysis of geospatial data (e.g. remote sensing analysis, vector mapping, environmental modeling).

Accepted applicants will be asked to pay a fee of $200 upon final registration. This fee will include participation in the course, and snacks and beverages during the day for the duration of the course.

Instructors

Randy LeVeque, UW Applied Math

Rob Fatland, UW IT Director of Cloud and Data Solutions

Anthony Arendt, UW eScience, APL

Katherine Kuhn, UW Ecosystem Biogeochemistry Group

Allison Smith, UW School of Oceanography

Ben Hudson, UW Polar Science Center, APL

Emilio Mayorga, UW Applied Physics Lab

There are two steps required to apply to geohackweek 2016:

Register for the event

Fill out participant information form

After you complete these two steps we will e-mail you with a confirmation. Contact us if you have questions!

Tentative schedule

Time Monday Tuesday Wednesday Thursday Friday
Morning Welcome and introduction Google Earth Engine Workshop open datasets / database management lightning talks Project work
Afternoon Google Earth Engine Tutorial Google Earth Engine Workshops Remote sensing / data visualization Team projects Project presentations / unconference
Evening Welcome reception Hackathon sessions Guest speaker reception Seattle outing Farewell reception
